content: The Act is titled the "Library of Congress Sound Recording and Film Preservation Programs Reauthorization Act of 2008." It includes provisions for the reauthorization of the National Recording Preservation Board and criteria for the removal of its members. The Act reauthorizes the National Recording Preservation Board and outlines criteria for removing members who fail to attend meetings or fulfill their responsibilities. Additionally, the National Recording Preservation Foundation's funding is reauthorized for the first fiscal year. The chapter reauthorizes the National Recording Preservation Board and allows board members to serve more than 2 terms. It also permits the board to determine the location of its principal office. SEC. 3. FILM PRESERVATION PROGRAMS. The National Film Preservation Act of 1996 is amended to clarify limitations on the use of funds for administrative expenses and reauthorize the National Film Preservation Board. The National Film Preservation Act of 1996 is amended to expand authorized uses of the seal by the Library or others for limited purposes to promote the National Film Registry. Amendments include inserting new provisions for fiscal years and removing a sentence from Section 113. The National Film Preservation Act of 1996 is amended to update names of organizations on the board and reauthorize the National Film Preservation Foundation. The National Film Preservation Act of 1996 is amended to authorize appropriations to the Library of Congress for fiscal years 2005 through 2016. The funds are to match private contributions for repatriation of films from foreign archives. The National Film Preservation Act of 1996 is amended to authorize appropriations to the Library of Congress for fiscal years 2005 through 2016, including the repatriation of American films from foreign archives. Amendments include extending the deadline for filling vacancies in the board of directors from 60 days to 120 days.
